text: Bottle shared at RBWG: Poured reddish color with a white head. Aroma was fruity filled berries. Taste was sour and tart berries.

750mL bottle at a tasting. Pours a glowing, hazy, bright pink with light pink erupting foam. Sweet pink grapefruit nose is zesty and fresh hitting that perfect aroma for me. I guess Brett plus berries here creates that more sweet grapefruit aroma. Flavor is acid and bubbles up front, moving to nondescript berry medley in the mid. Quicker finish with good balance - not a citric lemon bomb. Really loved this one.

Bottle @ RBWG 2016. Thanks to Joe for this. Bright reddish beer that does indeed look like fruit punch. A layer of pink foam, too. Theres a whole lot of blackberry, cherry, and lemon. A bit acetic, but the fruits really dominate and shine. Maybe a light spice and pie filling thing going on. I dig it.

[1/30/16] Bottle sample at the Encomium bottle share, after RateBeer Best awards ceremony at Hyatt Vineyard Creek Hotel in Santa Rosa. Thanks everyone who shared bottles! Cloudy red. Huge jammy berries, funk, lacto, oak. Great stuff.

Bottle at RBWG. Pours a cloudy reddish violet appearance with an off white head. Some vanilla and cinnamon along with berries and cherries in the nose. Soda and bright berry like with lots of white wine along with blackberries. Fun to drink.

750 ml bottle to taster. Looks good; a hazy reddish orange with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells tart with a nice balance of yeast and berries. Tastes like it smells with what seems like some brett as well. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied. Delicious.
Bottle at RBWG 2016. Thanks to Joenugs. Bringing the whalez! Nose is lightly acidic. Some cigarette aspect. Taste is lightly lemon with a raspberry overtone. Pretty damn decent

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy pink with low whitish head. Aroma is of fruits, vegetal stuff. Taste is of fruits, acidity. Palate: Light body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Good, reasonnable. Nice rusticity.

750ml bottle shared by AdamChandler. Thanks, Adam! Pours orange red brown with an off white head. Aroma is acetic, oak. Flavor is tart cherry, boysenberry, raspberry, lemon. This is sharply acidic and not really a saison anymore.

750 ml bottle thanks to AdamC. Hazy Amber/ red pour, almost no head. Aroma is very acidic oak with hints of blackberry. Wow... Sharp acidic notes, oak tannin with sharp pucker in the taste buds. Red wine vinegar... If you just want to drink vinegar go to your local supermarket and grab some off the shelf. How high is this rated? What? Why? I really like this brewery and have been in person but not sure what the huge deal is here. This is NOT a saison... Sour wild ale... Yes. Saison, no.
Poured from bottle thanks AdamChandler. Hazy amber pour with a thin white head. Aromas of acidic sour juicy berry. Taste is very tart sour with notes of oak and wine.

750ML acquired in a trade. Zero gushing and split 6 ways at fridge temp.

A - The appearance is like a strawberry / cherry juice. Hazy, a little yellow appearance. a 2 finger head that fades fast to a thin line with some bigger bubbles. 

S - The aroma is acidic, sharp, juicy and a lot of berry in this one. I get a bit of hat oak from the cask 200 puncheon. 

T - The berry fruit salad is certainly presence. Sharp, acidic and too sour for me but the fruitiness is really interesting and Im enjoying the berliner weisse. oak and wine characters at the end.

M - Thin, a very sharp bubbly feeling and an oily finish.

O - I expected this to be too sour. Some of the base Cask 200 variants when fresh were pretty awesome and after some time, they get a bit too sour and I think the berries just took it over the edge.

Hazy red pour without head. Aroma is sour cherry and sour berry. Very fruit forward in smell and taste. Lots of sour berries in taste. Its aptly named. But it is sour enough it leaves my tongue hurting. Thanks Adam!

Pours a cloudy red with a small rim that leaves low lacing. Nose is of rubber, fruits and vinegar. Taste is of red fruits and moderately acid. Like natural unsweetened raspberry juice. Lemony. Body is light to medium, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is certainly vinous. Acidity level is almost sharp and I found it to be lacking a bit of complexity. I did not enjoy it that much in the end because of all that...A good american sour maybe, but a saison?

pours hazy/cloudy red-pink with a small pinkish cap, some retention. berry plethora, tropical melons, strawberries, complex flora, rustic wood, spicy maltiness, spices. moderate carbonation, light body - oily; dry and gently tart citrusy-spicy finish. no particular seeizon character but this has the right to be called fruit punch compared to #1, relatively speaking. very solid fruit saison.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared at tasting. Hazy-cloudy red with a small ring of reddish-white foam leaving little lacing. Aroma is intensely fruity with a lot of berries, nice funk, leathery brettanomyces and a very light minty touch. Taste is slightly sweet, but well balanced by a sharp tartness. Berries forward, herbal notes, leathery brettanomyces, lemon, herbal notes and watermelon. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Dry finish. Another wonderful tart and fruity beer from Sante Adairius. Tasty and enjoyable!

Bottle. Glowing pink purple pour with ring of white foam. Aroma is lightly winey, light raspberry, funky, spicy notes, cinnamon. Taste is fruity, lots of watermelon, I cant believe the watermelon flavor here, light raspberry, nice tartness. Palate is med bodied, strong carbonation. Quite tasty.
25.4 oz bottle - thx Kirk! Cloudy pale red hue. Bitter berry nose. Nice jammy edge to the sourness. Slightly-ripened blackcap raspberries in the taste.
750 ml. shared bottle. Pours a somewhat cloudy red with a small red tinted head. Aroma of berries, fruit, and wood. Taste is blackberry, tart fruit, and oak. Nice one!
Bottle to glass. Pours a nice rose light purplish color with an off white head. This beer deserves the name of fruit punch! Excellent berry juice character. Very quenchable.

[ 75cl Bottle ][ 7oz ][ @tasting ][ $ - ? ][ Tulip ][ 07.14.15 ]Darker cherry color than Fruit Punch #1, large bubbled thin white head drops quick. Heavy acid and cherry nose, rubber phenol. Slick front palate is heavy acid, cherry, again the wheat-doughy contrast mid, sickly and filmy with high effervescence, way fuller body than 1, acids burning strong in finish way sticky, rubbery-phenol, skin-like end. 1 is more integrated, 2 has heavy acid and fruit fighting with the now-expeced sweet, filmy SARA body.

Pour is much darker than 1, ruby red, hazed, light pink head. Nose is really light, raspberry puree, lacto, some fuddled malt. Taste follows suit, muddled malt, lacto, raspberry, nothing too strong, a little sweet, hints of a rubbery phenol in the finish. Fuller body, a touch syrupy, moderate carb.
Bottle. Murky pink Quartz pour with a white head. Muted berry aromas. Sour berry highlights. Not very complex. Some malty backbeats. Average body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Hazy and murky red body. Thin collar. Aroma has lots of oak. Light berry and wine mix. Acidic. Tastes of berry fruits. Sour immediately. Pretty strong. Oak is strong too. Gives it a bit of yogurt in the finish. It does have a bit of a fruit punch flavor in the aftertaste. Medium light body. Low carbonation. Very tasty. The flavor blend together very well.
Bottle - Pours a hazy ruby red. Nose is blackberries, boysenberries, lemons, tart. Taste is blackberries up front with tart, lemons, sour. Really well balance and very good!

Bottle thanks to northernbrews. Aromais tart blackberry jam and lots of oak. Tastes more complex. Ultra tart raspberry, blackberry, and blueberry. Light to moderate sourness. Some red wine in the finish. Very good.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of tart berries, mild lemon, must, and a touch of oak. It pours pinkish-orange with a small pinkish head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of berries. He finish has moderate-heavy sour lemon, citrus, orange peel, and oak. Its light-medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Bottle shared by Jared. Really nice beer. 750mL bottle into a tulip rose hued color with minimal head. Aroma is jammy fruits with a slight funk and nice citrus zing. Taste is mild acidity and berry sweetness with an oaky funk. Well rounded and great.

Bottle thanks to Jared.
Light red pour with quickly dissipating head. 

Very tart, with lots of berry flavors, IT tastes a few ounces for your palate to adjust to the tartness, great berry aroma. 

The tartness however doesnt balance the fruit and im afraid some of the delicate nuances in the boysenberries and blackberries are destroyed. That is what is preventing this from entering the 4.4+ rating area.

Bottle shared, pours Crimson color with small white head, fades to a ring. Aromas and flavor are blackberry, strawberry jam, sweet tarts, sour blueberries, pink lemonade and funky oak. Mouth watering tart minerals and ultra clean rock salts left behind in the mouth. No acidic properties but pretty sour for Sante, the balance is insane on this juice.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours near purple with an off-white head. Aroma of light sourness/tartness, some berries, light malts, light malts, hints of oak. Flavor the same with a nice blend and a cool fruit note. Average texture. A solid beer.
Bottle. Pours pink white head. Nose/taste of boysenberry, oak, funk, blackberry, sour acid - medium body.
Bottle. Ruby pour with white head. Berries, all different ones, very tart aromas. Boysenberries make this some much richer, sour, tart and sweet fruit/berries.

The beer is red with some magenta. Little to no head. Just some white bubbles. The aroma is blackberries, cherries, raspberries and tart lime-ish lacto tartness. Very fruity flavor. Mild sourness. Light and refreshing. Very easy to drink.
Bottle - Funk and watermelon with other nice melon notes. Pinkish hue with a small white head. Lots of melon, tart with some light acidity. More melon and lacto. Very nice.

Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy purple with medium off white head that lasts. The aroma is strong berry, funk, and stone fruit. Thin mouth, tart berry, light funk, oak tannin, sour fruit punch really enjoyed this.

Pinkish brown hue, no foam. Funk aroma is first, overlays fruit but not obvious which one, raspberry if I had to pick. Tart, assertive raspberry flavor, wine, toasted wood, dry. Different than #1, very good in its own right.

750 ml. bottle at home. It pours a nice deep strawberry red color with a small, fizzy pink head. The aroma jumps out with a surprising amount of funk, barnyard, cheese and of course lots of fruity dark berries. The flavor is definitely Cantillon-like with huge puckering acidity, great fruit character and mild background notes of funky cheese. Theres not really any strong mineral character to the mouthfeel, and it actually has a little bit of body due to the higher gravity I suppose. No acetic acid or solvents. The finish is spectacularly tart and fruity. As it warms it becomes more and more apparant how perfectly this beer is named. Fruit Punch is spot on. While this is undoubtedly a GREAT American sour beer, none of the four rateable categories blew my mind, however the overall beer is greater than the sum of its parts if that makes any sense... Delicious stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2015 Bottle at the brewery. Aroma is rather fruity with a great berry character, but also a light poopy, sulfur aroma. Some light tropical fruit and citrus with a hint of phenolics. Pours a cloudy purple red with a small, moderately thick, pinkish head with decent retention as it recedes to the edges. Medium lacing and small legs. Flavor has medium light acidity with quite a bit of berry fruit notes. Light pale malt notes with some light citrus and tropical fruit. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, a very delicious berry saison. Lots of jammy, berry notes but the base beer?s character shows through nicely.

Bottle. Pours quite hazy deep magenta, small pink head, good lacing. Aroma is cantillon like, funky, horse blanket, basement, fruity, but no real specificity. More raspberry than anything. Flavor is medium tart, dry, light plus funk, super fruity, blueberries and other fruits, really smooth. Nice lingering tart funkiness. This is Saras answer to Lou Pepe, and it competes well. Kudos.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 Half pour on draft (March 1, 2015) and from the bottle. Aroma has medium jammy quality, with an edge toward the boysenberries, than seedy blackberry. There is a nice stone fruit presence as well which I take as the base beer poking through a bit.  Not much funk coming through on draft but the bottle has huge barnyard funk to the tune of Cantillon Lou Pepe Framboise. The beer pours hazy purple/red with off white head that goes to the sides of the glass. Taste is berry pie, berry preserves, light tropical fruit note, lacto/brett funk, and rich boysenberry. The blackberry comes through in the form of the seedy jam. Nice mélange of berry flavors with moderate drying oak tannin. The body is medium-full with medium-high carbonation. After taste is funky berry, medium acid. Awesome beer and even better out of the bottle!

On tap at Lupulo. Pours crimson purple with a whitish pink head. Funky jammy aroma with egg tarts and berry pie. Flavor follows, soft greek yogurt with blackberries and a bit of blueberry skins. Delightful!
